Name: Amazonas
Description: A large and sparsely populated region, mostly covered by the Amazon rainforest, known for its indigenous communities and biodiversity.

Name: Anzoategui
Description: A region known for its oil industry, beautiful beaches, and the nearby Mochima National Park.

Name: Apure
Description: A region located in the western plains of Venezuela, known for its agriculture and cattle ranching.

Name: Aragua
Description: A region known for its mountainous terrain, agricultural production, and proximity to the capital city, Caracas.

Name: Barinas
Description: A region known for its agriculture, including rice, sugar, and livestock, and the birthplace of many prominent Venezuelan figures.

Name: Bolivar
Description: A vast region rich in natural resources, known for its mining industry and the famous Angel Falls.

Name: Carabobo
Description: A central region that includes the country s industrial heartland, with significant manufacturing and agricultural production.

Name: Cojedes
Description: A region known for its agricultural production and its role in the development of Venezuela’s agricultural sector.

Name: Delta Amacuro
Description: A coastal region characterized by rivers and wetlands, home to various indigenous tribes and rich in biodiversity.

Name: Falcon
Description: A coastal region known for its beaches, historical significance, and the capital city of Coro.

Name: Guarico
Description: A region in the central plains, known for its extensive agriculture, particularly in rice and livestock.

Name: Lara
Description: A region known for its agricultural production, particularly coffee and sugar, as well as the city of Barquisimeto.

Name: Miranda
Description: A region located around Caracas, known for its suburban areas and mountainous landscapes.

Name: Monagas
Description: A region known for its oil industry and the capital city of Maturín.

Name: Nueva Esparta
Description: A region consisting of islands in the Caribbean, known for its tourism industry and the beaches of Margarita Island.

Name: Portuguesa
Description: A region known for its agricultural production, particularly in sugarcane and rice, and its rural landscapes.

Name: Sucre
Description: A coastal region known for its beaches, seafood, and the city of Cumaná.

Name: Tachira
Description: A region located on the border with Colombia, known for its mountainous terrain and coffee production.

Name: Trujillo
Description: A region known for its coffee and sugarcane production, as well as its historical significance in Venezuela s independence.

Name: Yaracuy
Description: A region located in the western part of Venezuela, known for its agriculture, particularly rice and sugarcane.

Name: Zulia
Description: A region located on the western border with Colombia, known for its oil production and proximity to Lake Maracaibo.
